titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the James B. Coover Collection of Jazz Recordings, circa 1950-1957
Coover (James B.) Collection of Jazz Recordings
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by John Bewley.

publicationstmt.publisher: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library
publicationstmt.p: Â© 2013. State University of New York at Buffalo. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in EAD by John Bewley November 2013.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.unittitle: James B. Coover Collection of Jazz Recordings, circa 1950-1957
did.langmaterial: Collection material is recorded material. The only written content is the program notes all of which are in English.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: State University of New York at Buffalo. Music Library

did.abstract: The collection contains 84 10-inch sound recordings of jazz, blues, ragtime, and boogie woogie.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Specified item], James B. Coover Collection of Jazz Recordings, circa 1950-1957, Music Library, The State University of New York at Buffalo.

accessrestrict.head: Terms of Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials can be examined by qualified researchers in the Music Library during hours of operation during which Music Librarians are present. In order to insure access, researchers are advised to contact the Music Library in advance of visits.

userestrict.head: Copyright
userestrict.p: Copyright for the materials in the collection does not reside with the Music Library. Therefore, patrons wishing to publish any item, or part of an item from this collection for any purpose, are responsible for securing requisite permissions.

accruals.head: Accruals and Additions
accruals.p: No further accruals are expected to this collection.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: James B. Coover (1925-2004) served as Director of the Music Library at the State University of New York at Buffalo 1967-1999. During that time he was responsible for building a major research collection from almost nothing. Jazz was one of his many interests and his love of the music is reflected in this collection of rarer early recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection contains 84 10-inch sound recordings of various types of jazz and blues music issued in the 1950s. It includes many of the most prominent jazz musicians, including Louis Armstrong, Jack Teagarden, Miles Davis, Bix Beiderbecke, Dizzy Gillespie, Jelly Roll Morton, Stan Getz, Gerry Mulligan, Chet Baker, and many others.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is alphabetically arranged by manufacturer label name and then in manufacturer's number.

scopecontent.p: Contents: Love for sale -- I've got a pocket full of dreams -- blues for Ruby -- I've got he world on a string -- Please -- Old folks

note.p: Album title: Two part inventions in jazz, vol.2 / Ruby Braff and Ellis Larkins

scopecontent.p: Contents: Blues for Ellis -- A city called heaven -- What is there to say -- Sailboat in the moonlight -- When a woman loves a man -- You are too beautiful -- Skylark

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: All recordings in the collection are cataloged in WorldCat and are available in University at Buffalo Libraries' Catalog, by performing a search under "James B Coover collection of jazz recordings".
